Selected Answer: A
Which of the following should the PM do NEXT to comply with the new legislation?

A. Use only full-time employees even if the project is delayed.
[CORRECT] PM should simply incorporate the legislation into day-to-day practices.

B. Hire all team members to avoid any delay in the project.
Hiring is a company/HR decision, not the PM.

C. Close the contract and pay the contractors cash for the remainder of the project.
Paying cash appears to be unethical and an attempt to circumvent the new legislation.

D. Look for an overseas vendor to finalize the project work.
Appears to circumvent the intent of the legislation, and would likely cause compliance issues.

Selected Answer: A
Another CompTIA question that gets you with its wording.. I chose A with this reasoning.
"Project is over budget... Country's las requires release or hire on full-time"

Answer B & D requires more budget which will goes against the already over budget. B being a possibility, however I am thinking if you contract out work its temporary and cheaper in the short run (long run includes payroll, medical, etc..)

C: implies paying the contractors "under the table" to complete the project which will never be an option.

A is the only option in my opinion that complies with legislation, and the already over budget constraint.

Note: it does not state whether the CCB will approve more funding to hire more individuals nor allow it to extend the timeline so just based off the information provided in the question A was the only conclusion I was able to come up with.

Selected Answer: C
This option ensures compliance with the new legislation while also honoring the existing contracts with the contractors. Paying out the remainder of the contract allows the project to proceed in a legal and ethical manner, avoiding any complications that could arise from non-compliance.

Selected Answer: B
In order to avoind delays and obey the laws it would be in the best interest of the PM to hire all team member and keep the project party going without delay.

A project manager is coordinating multiple teams of six people that will each provide feedback for a new product. The teams are recording their opinions, which may be used to define the final product that is sent to mass production. Which of the following BEST describes this technique?

discussion.content:

Focus group: This is a research technique where a small, targeted group of people discuss a specific topic or product. In this case, each team of six people functions as a focus group, providing feedback on the new product. Their opinions will be used to inform the final design before mass production.

questions.question_text: During an agile project, a team member checked the project artifacts in order to anticipate when all the work should have been completed. Which of the following charts was the team member MOST likely consulting?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Burndown chart: This is a staple of Agile methodologies. It visually tracks the remaining work in a sprint by plotting the amount of work left (user stories, tasks, etc.) against time. By looking at the trend of the burndown chart, a team member can get a sense of when the remaining work is likely to be completed.

questions.question_text: A PM wants to add a chart to the monthly status report to show major accomplishments for key events. Which of the following is the BEST chart to use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Gantt Chart
A Gantt chart, while not called a "milestone chart," is commonly used to show both tasks and key milestones. Milestones are often displayed as markers on a Gantt chart to indicate major events or accomplishments. It’s a widely used project management tool for visualizing schedules and accomplishments.
Conclusion:

The term "Milestone Chart" isn’t a common specific term in the Project+ exam, but understanding how to track milestones using tools like Gantt charts or milestone lists is important
